title: Jinbe's Speech Foreshadows His Role as Straw Hat Crew Member
theory: Jinbe's emotional intervention and his ability to reach Luffy when no one else could foreshadows his eventual joining of the Straw Hat Pirates. His wisdom, emotional intelligence, and understanding of Luffy's pain demonstrate why he would become an invaluable crew member. The fact that he helped Luffy remember what he still has - his crew - symbolically makes Jinbe part of that crew himself.
author: One Piece Fan Community

spoilerWarning.spoilerDescription: This theory discusses Jinbe's eventual joining of the Straw Hat crew, which happens much later in the series

evidence: Jinbe demonstrates the exact qualities needed for a Straw Hat - loyalty, wisdom, and the ability to support Luffy
The emotional bond formed between Jinbe and Luffy in this episode is similar to bonds Luffy forms with other crew members before they join
Jinbe's promise to Ace to protect Luffy foreshadows his long-term commitment

title: The 'What Remains' Philosophy Will Define Luffy's Growth
theory: Jinbe's question 'What remains?' represents a fundamental shift in Luffy's character philosophy. After losing Ace, Luffy will grow stronger not just physically but emotionally, learning to treasure and protect what he still has rather than dwelling on losses. This philosophy will drive his decision to train for two years and become strong enough to protect his crew from any threat.
author: One Piece Analysis Community

spoilerWarning.spoilerDescription: Discusses the timeskip and Luffy's training decisions

title: Shanks' Presence at Ace's Burial Hints at Future Meeting
theory: Shanks standing at Ace's grave and silently encouraging Luffy to move forward is symbolic foreshadowing of their eventual reunion. Shanks has been watching over Luffy's journey from afar, and this moment suggests that when they finally meet again, Luffy will have grown strong enough to stand as Shanks' equal.
author: Grand Line Theory Crafters

title: Dadan's Outburst Reveals the True Weight of the D. Clan
theory: Dadan's emotional attack on Garp highlights the tragedy of the D. clan - those who bear the name are destined for greatness but also immense suffering. Garp's inability to save Ace despite his power represents the cruel fate that the D. clan faces. This scene foreshadows that more members of the D. clan will face similar tragic circumstances.

title: The Crew Voices Luffy Hears Are More Than Memory
theory: When Luffy hears his crew members calling to him, it's not just his imagination or memory - it represents the actual spiritual/emotional bonds that connect the Straw Hats even when separated. This scene suggests that the crew's bonds transcend physical distance and that they may be able to sense each other's presence or emotions across the world.
